etymology.description: phonetic: 庚 (OC *kraːŋ) + semantic: 口 (“mouth”); OC 唐 *ɡl'aːŋ; original sense ‘to exaggerate, to boast’.
etymology.interpretation: Mouth signals a speech-related idea, while 庚 supplies the sound, yielding a sense of boastful or exaggerated speech. 庚 and 唐 were near-homophones in Old Chinese, and the top form traces to a contracted 庚; the graph later became the dynastic name Tang and a common surname.

examples.chinese: 唐朝鼎盛时期(唐朝鼎盛時期)，文化繁荣(文化繁榮)。
examples.english: During the height of the Tang dynasty, culture flourished.

examples.chinese: 他研究唐诗(他研究唐詩)，收藏唐三彩(收藏唐三彩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yánjiū Tángshī, shōucáng Táng sāncǎi.
examples.english: He studies Tang poetry and collects Tang tri-colored ware.

examples.chinese: 我们去唐人街(我們去唐人街)品尝点心(品嚐點心)。
examples.english: We went to Chinatown to taste dim sum.
